question.xref: DES s4, DES s10, HC r161
question.text: When you see a hazard ahead you should use the mirrors. Why is this?

explanation.text: You should be constantly scanning the road for clues about what is going to happen next. Check your mirrors regularly, particularly as soon as you spot a hazard. What is happening behind may affect your response to hazards ahead.

answer.text: Because you will need to accelerate out of danger
To assess how your actions will affect following traffic
Because you will need to brake sharply to a stop
To check what is happening on the road ahead
